entry.title: Game: Professor Layton and the Last Specter (DS, 2011) (3)
entry.content: I've been plugging along in the game doing one a day. I got the train mini-game today. It's a neat version of the car mini-game from the last one. The idea of dealing with multiple trains at a time sounds like it will be challenging.

entry.title: Game: Dragon Quest 4: Chapters of the Chosen (DS, 2007) (6)
entry.content:
I played for about three hours and did a lot of exploring and learning about the many quests I need to finish to get all the Zenithian equipment. There's a lot to keep track of and remember. I feel like I need to write it down. I think in a modern game there would be in-game markers of some kind that might make it to easy or feel to "fetch questy", but when you actually have to remember what's going on, it feels more real and fun. It's an interesting thing.

Here's my list: - The sword is near a waterfall - I have the water soaking stone - I need to go to a mine near the French stuff

Total time: 16:51

entry.title: Game: Dragon Quest 4: Chapters of the Chosen (DS, 2007) (5)
entry.content:
I played through a boss fight with a tiny bit of grinding to get strong enough for it. I got totally tooled the first time, but I got about one level per character, maybe two, and then totally destroyed the boss (Baal-something?) on the second try. It was weird. I thought the hidden sign was pretty cool and when I went back to the town I immediately remembered about the door I couldn't go to before. I like it when things like that work out.

Total time: 13:30

entry.title: Game: Dragon Quest 4: Chapters of the Chosen (DS, 2007) (4)
entry.content:
I played for about 30 minutes today and did a dungeon and a boss. It's nice how bite-sized this game can be. I'm really hurting for cash in the game though and I don't want to grind for it right now. I'd much rather grind to be able to go "deeper" into some place than just fighting enemies I know I can handle so I can get some cash.

Total time: 12:51

entry.title: Game: Dragon Quest 4: Chapters of the Chosen (DS, 2007) (3)
entry.content:
I played for about five hours today during my looong travel home. I got to the hero's story and I'm finding it a little confusing compared to what came before because so much of the world is available. I also always dislike it in games when I have a lot of options for which characters to use, because it is hard to make the "best" choice and keep all the characters balanced.

Total time: 12:24
